snippet: Mets pitcher Matt Harvey, weighing his decision about the partially torn ulnar collateral ligament in his right elbow, is scheduled to see the orthopedic surgeon Dr. James Andrews on Monday for a second opinion.
abstract: New York Mets pitcher Matt Harvey is weighing his decision about the partially torn ulnar collateral ligament in his right elbow; he is scheduled to see orthopedic surgeon Dr James Andrews for a second opinion; he has indicated that he would like to avoid surgery.
lead_paragraph: Mets pitcher Matt Harvey, weighing his decision about the partially torn ulnar collateral ligament in his right elbow, is scheduled to see the orthopedic surgeon Dr. James Andrews on Monday for a second opinion.

headline.main: Rehabilitation or Surgery? Ligament’s Stability Is Key in Harvey’s Choice
headline.print_headline: Rehabilitation or Surgery? Ligament’s Stability Is Key in Harvey’s Choice
